intro: Teramnus flexilis, commonly known as the flexible teramnus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically visited by various pollinators. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature.
